data.text:
Born in 1359 SH

Ali Sadeghi, better known by his stage name Ali Sadeghi, was born on 30 September 1359 in Tehran. He is an actor. He is the second child in the family and has an older brother and a younger sister. His father is a carpenter and his mother is a homemaker. He is a computer science graduate and started his artistic career in 1969 by playing in Aftab Alam Tab series. Amir Samavati, the director of this series, accidentally chose Ali Sadeghi, who was a student at that time, to act in this series.

In 1375, he played a role in the satirical series My Best Summer by Ali Bahadur and became famous. This collection had a humorous look at the category of Iran-Iraq war.

In 1378, he appeared in the series Pertohai Noor, and a year later, he co-starred in the TV series Dardesar Valadin with Mehran Madiri and Fatemeh Guderzi.

In 1380, he collaborated with Parisa Bakhtavar in the comic series behind the exams. The script of this series is written by Asghar Farhadi and Mohammad Reza Fazli, which was broadcast on Tehran channel in the holy month of Ramadan 2018.

In 1382, Sadeghi collaborated with Reza Attaran in the Koche Aqakia collection. Actors such as Manouchehr Nowzari and Ketayoun Amirbrahimi were present in this series.

In 1382, Sadeghi entered the cinema scene by acting in the movie Narrat Ganeh. In the same year, he played in the popular and successful satirical series Khane Be Doosh by Reza Attaran. This Ramadan series was broadcasted on the third channel of Sima in 2013. The movies Picnic in the Battle Field and Hasht Pa are among his other works in 1983.

In 2004, he once again collaborated with Reza Attaran in the satirical collection of the Accused. In this series, Sirus Gerjestani and Maryam Amirjalali were also present. Sadeghi played the role of Melika Zarei‚Äôs wife (Aunt Shadoune) in this series, because of this, the rumor of their marriage was raised among the people. Years later, Sadeghi denied and denied this news on the Iranian dinner program. In 1982, Sadeghi also acted in the films Left Hand and Hoo.

In 1385, he was present in the comic series Residential Camp by Javad Razovian and worked with famous actors such as Javad Ezzati and Mehran Ghafurian. Then he appeared in the series Life on the Condition of Laughter and the movie If You Can Catch Me by Shahid Ahmadlou.

In 2016, he was present in the comedy series Three in Four by Majid Salehi. This series is one of the most successful TV comedy series. In the same year, he starred in the movie Khatarin Pirmerd.

In 1387, he collaborated with Reza Attaran again in the comedy series Bezengah. Based on a script by Soroush Sehat and Iman Safaei, this series was aired on the third channel of Sima in the holy month of Ramadan 2018. This series is the last work of Reza Attaran on TV. Sadeghi then played a role in this year‚Äôs Eid comedy series by Saeed Aghakhani. In 1987, Sadeghi appeared in the movies Kish and Mat, Khatere Shab Barani, Sweet Life, First Move, Tigh Zan and Siyazangi.

In 2008, he acted in the series ‚ÄúZan Baba‚Äù directed by Saeed Aghakhani. In this series, Siros Gerzhestani, Mohammad Kasbi and Mahmoud Bahrami were present. In the same year, Sadeghi also played a role in the movie ‚ÄúShir and Asal‚Äù directed by Arash Meiriyan. The film Zamhrir directed by Ali Royeen was his next work in 1988. Famous actors such as Jamshid Mashayikhi, Afshana Baygan, Dawood Rashidi, Akbar Abdi and Amin Tarkh were present in this film. Sadeghi then starred in the movie Afternoon Segi Segi directed by Mustafa Kiai. played At the end of 1988, he appeared in the movie ‚ÄúMarriage in Overtime‚Äù directed by Saeed Sohaili. The film failed due to its release at the wrong time.

Ali Sadeghi collaborated once again in 1989 with Siros Gerzhestani, Hamid Lolaei and Saeed Aghakhani in the collection of happy people. Acting in the Moj and Rock series was his other work in 1989.

Sadeghi was very prolific in cinema in 1989. He first acted in the movie Hamchi Aroma. This was a social satirical film made by Mustafa Mansouryar. 3 degrees of fever and mixed pizza were his other works in 1989. Sadeghi continued to work with Rambod Javan in the successful and best-selling comedy ‚ÄúNo Man‚Äôs Arriving‚Äù. Then he appeared in the movie ‚ÄúNo Entry of the Living Dead‚Äù by Javad Mazdabadi.

In 1990, Sadeghi acted in two satirical series, Whose Sleep? by Javad Razovian and Punq Sarkhat by Saeed Aghakhani. In the same year, he played a role in the movie A Fugitive in Bagbo by Hatef Alimardani, along with Soroush Sehat, Bahareh Rahnama and Sahar Valdebigi. . In 1990, Sadeghi was a participant in the series of Iranian dinner home shows directed by Soroush Sehat.

In 2013, he acted in the series Tasat made by Ahmad Zakari. This series was broadcasted on Panj Sima channel. He then worked in the movie Iron Man.

In 2012, he played a role in the series We Are Not Angels. Then he acted in the movies Shir Ya Khat, Conditional Marriage and Love and Punishment.

In 2013, he appeared in the television series Mearaji Ha with Masoud De Namaki. This series was a spin-off from the movie ‚ÄúEjected‚Äù that was broadcasted on the first channel of Sima. He then went in front of the camera in the films Raaz Khane Behjat and Gore Talai. In the same year, Sadeghi played in the series Hangi Signal.
